alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Kiowa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Comanche, southern Caddo and east central Kiowa Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Anadarko to 3 miles northeast of Lake Ellsworth to 7 miles southwest of Meers. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Lawton, Anadarko, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Fort Cobb, Cement, Medicine Park, Gracemont, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Boone, Fort Sill, Lake Ellsworth, Lake Chickasha, Fort Cobb Reservoir and Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 40 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
